data.text: @HFentonMudd @TWenseleers @Unusual_Times Like with every flu season before 2020… you can’t prevent the fact that people get sick or have to be hospitalized, and some of them will die too. The goal is for the hospitals to be able to cope with the workload… and that doesn’t seem to pose a problem anymore

@TWenseleers @visjevangen Bestaan er al modellen die obv dalende immuniteit komende golven voorspellen? Ik weet tis veel gevraagd, maar planning VC najaar gebeurt nu. En sommige "lokale actoren" rekenen op afgeschaalde centra  in verwachting dat in najaar aan rustig tempo kan gevaccineerd worden...

@visjevangen Hopelijk niet... Anderzijds: ook als cijfers de goede richting uitgaan kom ik dat wel vertellen. Maar ga alleen nog grafiekjes posten als ik 1 of andere changepoint zie, want anders wordt dit voor iedereen (en ook voor mij) wat vermoeiend. https://t.co/lgEWv2gaAB

@TWenseleers "we assume no waning of vaccine-induced immunity after booster vaccination doses over the time span considered in this note." Not sure this is a good assumption, given that the elderly population was boosted many months ago and UK is currently attributing hosp increase to it

@TWenseleers Happy to see you back. My instinct would also be that it should be a small wave, but I'm a bit spooked by the huge increase in cases in the Netherlands, even before they drop all measures. Any reason what happens there will not happen here?
@TWenseleers does your model already factor in the masks mandate lift ?
@TWenseleers Tell that to the people that were told that their infection would be mild and are now having debilitating long covid symptoms.
@TWenseleers Vertel dat eens aan de senior writer die alweer in zijn schuilkelder zit…
@TWenseleers This is the third annual spring surge. If you don't factor that in, you'll just confuse everything.
